summary: Muse is a soft, clean preset, tweaked with performance during regular gameplay in mind. Fate is a dark, desaturated technicolour variant. Custom weathers. BETA.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static-8.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/65219-0-1446830470.png[/img][/center]
[font=Century Gothic][center][size=2]This has been a longterm, evolving personal preset, but a couple of people had expressed interest so here it is.
My goals were simply a generally brighter look that wasn't an overly saturated bloom soup,
had no boring weathers and didn't take performance out back and put a bullet in it.

[u][i]If you like heavy saturation and flashy lens effects, you will probably be very bored.[/i][/u]


REVAMPED EXTERIOR FOG IS [u]REQUIRED[/u].


[/size]
[size=4][b]OVERVIEW[/b][/size]
[size=2]Soft colours and more subtle bloom **
Many custom weathers for sky colour/lighting/cloud variety
Sunglare mimics human eye -- no camera lens effects
Pretty bokeh DoF effect
Everything tweakable via in-game GUI

[/size]** Fate instead uses a dark, desaturated technicolour effect ([u][b]EXPERIMENTAL!!)[/b][/u]


[size=4][b]ABOUT "REALISM"[/b][/size]
[size=2][i] It's a fantasy preset, but I didn't crank values willy nilly. For instance:[/i]
Interior window brightness is adjusted to weather/time of day, water is choppier in storms,
candles show up more strongly at night than in the day, etc.[/size]


[size=4][b]LIGHTING AND OVERHAULS[/b][/size]
[size=2]Prod80, the brain behind the custom coding Muse uses, does not recommend using lighting overhauls with his files.
However, vanilla lighting issues drive me bonkers, so Muse was tweaked with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17609/?]Relighting Skyrim[/url] installed.
The intended balance was that nights and dungeons be playable [i]without[/i] a torch, but easier to navigate [i]with[/i] one.[/size]



[size=4][b]INSTALLATION[/b][/size]

[size=2]1. Drop everything inside my Muse ENB folder into your [b]MAIN SKYRIM folder[/b].

2. Download the .279 binaries [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0279.htm]here[/url] (the down arrow all the way at the bottom of the page!)
and copy the d3d9.dll file (wrapper version) into your [b]MAIN SKYRIM folder[/b].

3. Make sure Skyrim's antialiasing is turned OFF.

4. Edit the following values in your [b]skyrimprefs.ini[/b] at Documents\My Games\Skyrim
(Mod Organizer users need to do this via the "puzzle piece" icon in MO)

[b][Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1
fGamma=1.0000[/b]

5.  Use [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:ENBlocal_INI]this guide[/url] to configure your memory settings.
[/size]


[size=4][b]COMPATIBILITY[/b][/size]
[spoiler]

[size=3][b]COMPATIBLE
[/b][/size][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/28016/?]Expanded Snow Systems[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=190651656]Go to bed [/url] and similar mods
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52471/?]Important Information Overhaul
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22274/?]Predator Vision
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60504/?]See Red [/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63478/?]True Storms[/url] (vanilla option)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68496/?]Vivid Snow[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64941/?]Wonders of Weather[/url]
vanilla Nighteye
any mod that relies on fade-to-black effect[/size]


[size=3][b]MOST WEATHER OVERHAULS ARE INCOMPATIBLE[/b][/size]
[size=2][i]Because of how this ENB hooks into vanilla values, and because of the extensive per-weather edits,
it is generally [u]NOT DESIGNED[/u]  for weather overhaul mods, including:

[/i]Climates of Tamriel
Pure Weathers/Purity
RCRN

[b]Also NOT compatible:[/b]
ATMOSPHERE
Enhanced Lights and FX
Enhanced Lighting for ENB (ELE)
Remove Interior Fog[/size][/spoiler]
[size=4]
[b]RECOMMENDED/USED IN SCREENSHOTS[/b][/size]
[size=2]Please see the list [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50182/?]here[/url].[/size][/center][/font]
author: Ruse

files.name: Muse ENB 0.11 for .279
files.changelogHtml:
Added missing effect file (oops)
Rearranged folders for neater installation/uninstallation
Fate no longer requires Muse, it's a standalone download
